column5: Hey Guys  Headed out to Simcoe a couple of times in September and here are some the Smallies I was able to hook into. All fish were caught between 20-30 FOW and most came on tubes while a couple on the drop shot rig! Lost some real giants but got a 6 lber and am looking on hooking into a 7 lber before the season ends. They seem to be on the fall pattern already but have been hard to locate schools of big ones, catch a couple but never more then 2 or 3. I have been able to catch boat loads on 2 lbers which are still lots of fun. Here are some of the smallies caught  Here is a 4lber I got on the Drop Shot    Here is 5.5 Lber I caught dragging a tube    Here is 5 Lbs Bass my friend caught, his PB Smallie    Here is the 6 lb 2 oz giant (He might be a 7 lber in November)
now I know what they mean by toad...they are some big toads  wow..nice fish
Very nice smalljaws.  They;ll be packing on the ounces yet!
Some nice looking bronzebacks  good job!!!!!!
Great report and pics Minnow  Man those are huge     Great job!  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice! Some very colorful hogs you got there! Thanks for sharing.
some piggies.....damn i wanna get out and do some of that   Hawk
Outstanding fish you guys caught. Congrads
Thoes are some football smallies! congrats on your catch minnow.  What do you mean when you say " drop shot " ?

Drop shot is a weight on the bottom of your rig, with the hook up the line (generally 10-20 inches) .... it helps you maintain bottom contact, while still keeping your bait in the strike zone, its a very effective way of fishing
WOW!  Those are some massive fish!
